org.semanticweb.vlog4j.graal

Class GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.semanticweb.vlog4j.graal.GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule

  • public class GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule
extends Object
    A utility class containing a Graal ConjunctiveQuery. Answering a Graal ConjunctiveQuery over a certain knowledge base is equivalent to adding a Rule to the knowledge base, prior to reasoning. The rule consists of the query Literals as the body and a single PositiveLiteral with a new predicate containing all the answer variables of the query as the head. After the reasoning process, in which the rule is materialised, is completed, this rule head can then be used as a query to obtain the results of the Graal ConjunctiveQuery.
    Author:
    Adrian Bielefeldt

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule

        protected GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule(String ruleHeadPredicateName,
                                      List<Term> answerVariables,
                                      Conjunction<PositiveLiteral> conjunction)
        Constructor for a GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule.
        Parameters:
        ruleHeadPredicateName - the query predicate name. Becomes the name of the rule head Predicate.
        answerVariables - the query answer variables. They become the terms of the rule head PositiveLiteral.
        conjunction - the query body. Becomes the rule body.

    • Method Detail

      • getRule

        public Rule getRule()
        A rule that needs to be added to the program to answer the Graal ConjunctiveQuery represented by this object. It consists of all query literals from the original Graal ConjunctiveQuery as the body and a single PositiveLiteral containing all the answer variables of the query as the head.
        Returns:
        The rule equivalent to the Graal ConjunctiveQuery represented by this object.

      • getQuery

        public PositiveLiteral getQuery()
        A query PositiveLiteral that returns the results of the Graal ConjunctiveQuery represented by this object, provided the corresponding rule (getRule()) has been added to the program. It is equal to the head of the rule returned by getRule().
        Returns:
        The query PositiveLiteral to obtain the results of the Graal ConjunctiveQuery represented by this object.
